workout_file.author: Zwift
workout_file.name: Week 1.1 - Watopia Flat Forward
workout_file.description: A race simulation on Watopia Flat Forward where you'll tackle 3 laps of the course.

textevent.message: Welcome to a race simulation on Watopia Flat Forward, my friend!
Let's start with a 10min warmup. Keep your cadence comfortable.
Do you have a towel, fan, and fluids? Make sure you do before we get too far into the warmup.
There's halfway; let's chat about what's coming up today.
As you know, today is a race simulation, so expect a hard effort with race-like efforts.
We'll tackle 3 laps of Watopia Flat Forward and do our best to mimic the demands of the course.
And provide some tips and tricks for success on the course come race day.
Let's continue with the warmup.
Next up, we have a couple of high cadence efforts.
Aim for 110 RPM for these, spin the legs up now.
GO GO GO! FAST FEET!
Great work! Now back to a comfortable cadence. We'll do that once more.
Spin the legs up again, so ERG doesn't bog down here.
UP UP! HARD EFFORT!
Awesome! Now let's take 90sec easy and get to the start pen.
Which is also our 1st tip today: Get to the race start pen 2-3min early ideally.
This will get you a good start position close to the front of the pack.
And a good start position is vital because Zwift races start VERY hard.
If you've ever done a cyclocross race, that's the best comparison.
This is why the race sim workouts of this plan all start with a 20sec hard effort.
Which is coming up just 30sec from now :-)
Start spinning the legs up now and prepare for a hard effort! Stand up if you'd like to.
GO GO GO!
Up and over the short riser before making the left turn towards Ocean Boulevard, keep the pressure on!
Short break now as we coast down into the ocean tunnel. Now's your best chance to recover from the start.
Excellent work, now that you're in the group, things usually settle down on this flat section.
Use this section to recover a bit more from the start and take a drink.
And get a feel for how the legs are today - Will you sit in mostly, or push the pace from the front?
By now, you should feel recovered from the hard start and have found your place in the field.
Which, by the way, is in the top 25%, but NOT on the front if you're trying to conserve energy.
Drafting is a significant component of racing, just like riding outdoors.
And minimizing that draft by riding in the field is an important skill to master.
Coming up next, we have a hard surge exiting the tunnel.
Everyone loves to go wild here, so be prepared to drop the hammer!
GO GO GO! Stay with the front of the field!
Good work! Back to the flats again now as we wind through the dirt roads of the fishing village.
Take a few sips of fluid here. Make sure you're frequently drinking.
Next, we're going up a slight grade. Drop your cadence to ~75 RPM.
Slow your cadence here to mimic the gradient. This part of the course can get tough.
So, do your best to hang onto the group if things get spicy.
We have a short downhill coming up next.
Back to a comfortable cadence here, take a few deep breaths.
And back onto the flats again as we wind past the waterfall.
This is also where the green jersey point is...Tip: DON'T go for it during a race :-)
Get ready for a BIG surge after the sprint point to start the Esses.
Hold the wheels here! Things will get strung out.
Get ready for the Esses next...Short and sharp surges, stay focused here.
DIG over the short risers.
And breathe on the way back down, but keep some pressure on to not lose the group.
Phew! That's 1 lap down...2 more to go. Enjoy this descent back to the start banner.
Get ready for that tricky left turn towards Ocean Boulevard again.
Give it some gas here!
Nice, coast down into the tunnel again.
And back in the tunnel on the flats. Recover again here from the short surge effort.
Now's another great opportunity to sip some fluids, and stand up to stretch the legs.
Get ready for the climb out of the tunnel and for everyone to go crazy again!
GO GO GO! Stay in the wheels again here and towards the front ideally.
Excellent! As we wind through the fishing village, catch your breath.
Don't get caught sleeping over that climb; it's a long chase back to the group.
Cadence down to 75 RPM next.
Stand up here if needed to stretch out the legs.
This is a place where riders will try to attack the field.
So pay attention up the road and don't miss 'the move'.
Nice and short descent again to catch your breath.
And heading past the waterfall over the cobbles towards the sprint again.
Don't follow the green jersey attempts...You won't see them again after the Esses.
Besides when you pass them on their way to get dropped from the bunch :-)
BIG effort coming up again entering the Esses, hang on!
GO GO GO!
Things will be strung out again here, maintain your position through the Esses.
And stay composed screaming down these descents and ripping through the corners.
Excellent work! Take a few deep breaths here as we descend to the start banner.
Bell lap! Get ready to surge again.
Just enough effort to maintain your position, nothing more!
Breathe and relax.
Steady as you go here. Take a few sips of fluid and stay relaxed.
Now's the time to think about race closing strategies...
Will you stay in the group and sprint for the line? Or attack early and hold them off?
Time for that pesky climb out of the tunnel again, give it some gas here!
UP UP UP!
That is a point where someone may attack for the win, so take a quick look up the road just in case.
However, a breakaway from that point rarely lasts long.
Get ready for that slight increase in gradient next.
Slow the cadence just a bit again here, and stand up if you need to stretch the legs.
You will likely see some breaks try to form again here, which rarely work...again :-)
Flat races always come down to the sprint, so conserve your energy in the group here.
Nice and easy here. This is the last rest opportunity you have today.
Stay patient through this section, but near the front.
Things will pop off frequently now, and especially as we get close to the final hill.
Ready? This is a make or break point of the race, MAKE IT!
DON'T GET DROPPED!
DIG DIG DIG!
Keep the power on through the Esses! C'mon!
Get ready to RIP it down the descent this time and sprint for the finish.
Keep the power on here, but wait to unleash your sprint...
Almost time, give it EVERYTHING next!
GO GO GO!
Nice! Way to get that workout done, my friend!
That's a tough one but will prepare you for the specific demands of Zwift racing.
We'll spend a few minutes cooling down now to complete the workout.
See you next time :-)
